response_parsed.title: Harden WebAssembly (WASM) Targets using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to strengthen the security of WebAssembly (WASM) targets in a FastAPI application using Python 3.12+.
key_points: Use Python 3.12+ for enhanced performance and improved security features
Leverage FastAPI's built-in security features like CORS, OAuth2, JWT, and more
Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) headers to restrict web content
Limit the exposed API endpoints to essential ones only
Keep your dependencies up-to-date to mitigate known vulnerabilities

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, CORSCorenter
app = FastAPI()

origins = ['*']

app.on_event('startup')(CORSCorenter(origins=origins))

from fastapi import Depends, HTTPException, Security

security = [Depends(Security(
    has_role('admin')
))]

version_notes: Python 3.12+: Improved performance and new features
FastAPI v0.70.0 or later for enhanced security features
caveats: Ensure to test thoroughly before deploying to production
Always consider the balance between security and usability when hardening your WASM targets
